item.title: UK Secret Order Demands That Apple Give Access to Users’ Encrypted Data
item.description: Plus: Benjamin Netanyahu gives Donald Trump a golden pager, Hewlett Packard Enterprise blames Russian government hackers for a breach, and more.
item.media:keywords: security roundup, hacking, cybersecurity, encryption, apple, data, Russia, Donald Trump, education
item.dc:creator: Lily Hay Newman
item.dc:subject: Security Roundup

item.title: ACLU Warns DOGE’s ‘Unchecked’ Access Could Violate Federal Law
item.description: The ACLU says it stands ready to sue for access to government records that detail DOGE’s access to sensitive personnel data.
item.media:keywords: DOGE, Elon Musk, artificial intelligence, privacy, data, government
item.dc:creator: Dell Cameron
item.dc:subject: Takeover

item.title: DOGE Teen Owns ‘Tesla.Sexy LLC’ and Worked at Startup That Has Hired Convicted Hackers
item.description: Experts question whether Edward Coristine, a DOGE staffer who has gone by “Big Balls” online, would pass the background check typically required for access to sensitive US government systems.
item.media:keywords: cybersecurity, security, hacking, Russia, politics, government, DOGE, Elon Musk
item.dc:creator: Andy Greenberg, David Gilbert, Lily Hay Newman
item.dc:subject: Work History

item.title: The Collapse of USAID Is Already Fueling Human Trafficking and Slavery at Scammer Compounds
item.description: The dismantling of USAID by Elon Musk's DOGE and a State Department funding freeze have severely disrupted efforts to help people escape forced labor camps run by criminal scammers.
item.media:keywords: Elon Musk, Crime, cryptocurrency, cybersecurity, privacy, government, DOGE
item.dc:creator: Matt Burgess, Lily Hay Newman
item.dc:subject: Rug Pull

item.title: Despite Catastrophic Hacks, Ransomware Payments Dropped Dramatically Last Year
item.description: Ransomware gangs continued to wreak havoc in 2024, but new research shows that the amounts victims paid these cybercriminals fell by hundreds of millions of dollars.
item.media:keywords: ransomware, security, malware, cybersecurity, hacking, Crime
item.dc:creator: Andy Greenberg, Lily Hay Newman
item.dc:subject: Downward Spiral

item.title: Meet the Hired Guns Who Make Sure School Cyberattacks Stay Hidden
item.description: An investigation into more than 300 cyberattacks against US K–12 schools over the past five years shows how schools can withhold crucial details from students and parents whose data was stolen.
item.media:keywords: cybersecurity, security, hacking, malware, Crime, ransomware, education
item.dc:creator: Mark Keierleber
item.dc:subject: Lockers

item.title: Foreign Hackers Are Using Google’s Gemini in Attacks on the US
item.description: Plus: WhatsApp discloses nearly 100 targets of spyware, hackers used the AT&T breach to hunt for details on US politicians, and more.
item.media:keywords: security roundup, cybersecurity, hacking, China, security, Russia, north korea, WhatsApp, Iran
item.dc:creator: Dhruv Mehrotra
item.dc:subject: Security Roundup

item.title: DeepSeek’s Safety Guardrails Failed Every Test Researchers Threw at Its AI Chatbot
item.description: Security researchers tested 50 well-known jailbreaks against DeepSeek’s popular new AI chatbot. It didn’t stop a single one.
item.media:keywords: DeepSeek, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cybersecurity, hacking, security, China, Crime
item.dc:creator: Matt Burgess, Lily Hay Newman
item.dc:subject: Hidden Cracks

item.title: Exposed DeepSeek Database Revealed Chat Prompts and Internal Data
item.description: China-based DeepSeek has exploded in popularity, drawing greater scrutiny. Case in point: Security researchers found more than 1 million records, including user data and API keys, in an open database.
item.media:keywords: artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, security, machine learning, vulnerabilities, databases, data privacy, DeepSeek
item.dc:creator: Lily Hay Newman, Matt Burgess
item.dc:subject: Basic Problems

item.title: The Trial at the Tip of the Terrorgram Iceberg
item.description: Atomwaffen Division cofounder and alleged Terrorgram Collective member Brandon Russell is facing a potential 20-year sentence for an alleged plot on a Baltimore electrical station. His case is only the beginning.
item.media:keywords: Crime, politics, terrorism, Telegram, extremism, far-right
item.dc:creator: Ali Winston
item.dc:subject: Far-Right Extremism

item.title: DeepSeek’s Popular AI App Is Explicitly Sending US Data to China
item.description: Amid ongoing fears over TikTok, Chinese generative AI platform DeepSeek says it’s sending heaps of US user data straight to its home country, potentially setting the stage for greater scrutiny.
item.media:keywords: China, artificial intelligence, machine learning, algorithms, privacy, national security, surveillance, DeepSeek
item.dc:creator: Matt Burgess, Lily Hay Newman
item.dc:subject: Collective Action

item.title: Scammers Are Creating Fake News Videos to Blackmail Victims
item.description: “Yahoo Boy” scammers are impersonating CNN and other news organizations to create videos that pressure victims into making blackmail payments.
item.media:keywords: cybersecurity, Crime, privacy, Telegram, Deepfakes
item.dc:creator: Matt Burgess
item.dc:subject: New Lows

item.title: US Privacy Snags a Win as Judge Limits Warrantless FBI Searches
item.description: Plus: A hacker finds an issue with Cloudflare’s systems that could reveal app users’ rough locations, and the Trump administration puts a wrench in a key cybersecurity investigation.
item.media:keywords: security roundup, security, cybersecurity, privacy, hacking, encryption
item.dc:creator: Andrew Couts
item.dc:subject: Security Roundup

item.title: Subaru Security Flaws Exposed Its System for Tracking Millions of Cars
item.description: Now-fixed web bugs allowed hackers to remotely unlock and start any of millions of Subarus. More disturbingly, they could also access at least a year of cars’ location histories—and Subaru employees still can.
item.media:keywords: cars, transportation, privacy, security, cybersecurity, hacks, vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Andy Greenberg
item.dc:subject: All Wheel Spies

item.title: Under Trump, US Cyberdefense Loses Its Head
item.description: Chinese hacks, rampant ransomware, and Donald Trump’s budget cuts all threaten US security. In an exit interview with WIRED, former CISA head Jen Easterly argues for her agency’s survival.
item.media:keywords: longreads, Big Interview, cybersecurity, China, hacking, National Affairs
item.dc:creator: Lily Hay Newman
item.dc:subject: empty chairs

item.title: Trump Frees Silk Road Creator Ross Ulbricht After 11 Years in Prison
item.description: Donald Trump pardoned the creator of the world’s first dark-web drug market, who is now a libertarian cause célèbre in some parts of the crypto community.
item.media:keywords: cryptocurrency, encryption, Crime, Donald Trump, silk road, dark web, politics
item.dc:creator: Andy Greenberg
item.dc:subject: Free Ross

item.title: How to Get Around the US TikTok Ban
item.description: TikTok is now unavailable in the United States—and getting around the ban isn’t as simple as using a VPN. Here’s what you need to know.
item.media:keywords: privacy, Apps, Social Media, security, TikTok, China, national security
item.dc:creator: Lily Hay Newman, Matt Burgess
item.dc:subject: Workarounds

item.title: US Names One of the Hackers Allegedly Behind Massive Salt Typhoon Breaches
item.description: Plus: New details emerge about China’s cyber espionage against the US, the FBI remotely uninstalls malware on 4,200 US devices, and victims of the PowerSchool edtech breach reveal what hackers stole.
item.media:keywords: security roundup, China, cybersecurity, hacking, security, FBI, education
item.dc:creator: Lily Hay Newman, Andy Greenberg
item.dc:subject: Security Roundup

item.title: The FCC’s Jessica Rosenworcel Isn’t Leaving Without a Fight
item.description: As the US faces “the worst telecommunications hack in our nation’s history,” by China’s Salt Typhoon hackers, the outgoing FCC chair is determined to bolster network security if it’s the last thing she does.
item.media:keywords: China, FCC, politics, telecoms, Broadband, hackers, national security, cyberattacks, cybersecurity
item.dc:creator: Eric Geller
item.dc:subject: Last Call

item.title: Hackers Likely Stole FBI Call Logs From AT&T That Could Compromise Informants
item.description: A breach of AT&T that exposed “nearly all” of the company’s customers may have included records related to confidential FBI sources, potentially explaining the bureau’s new embrace of end-to-end encryption.
item.media:keywords: cybersecurity, encryption, hacks, security, FBI, AT&T
item.dc:creator: Lily Hay Newman
item.dc:subject: Burned
